pageContext.claim: “As far as purchasing drugs from other countries until everything else kicks in, Canada pays 50 percent what we pay. I've given governors permission to go to Canada and buy drugs directly from Canada, saving as an example, Ron DeSantis the State of Florida, approximately 50 percent and more on the purchase of drugs.”
pageContext.analysis: As part of re-election campaign, Trump issued a rule in July that pushed to allow such importation and the Department of Health and Human Services issued in a final rule in late September establishing a path for states and certain other entities to set up drug importation programs. But he neglected to include Canada in the deal-making. Canadian health minister Patty Hajdu in late November announced new measures to protect the country's drug supply from bulk importations that could worsen drug shortages. It bars the distribution of certain drugs outside of Canada if that would cause or worsen a shortage.
